intro: Comastoma traillianum, commonly known as the Traill's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
